sentences.english: It is more fun to go with someone than to go alone.
sentences.chinese: 偕伴同去比自己独自去好玩。

sentences.english: Walk with a friend or group of friends.
Economic disaster has coincided with political chaos.
sentences.chinese: 祸不单行，经济灾难与政治混乱结伴同行。

sentences.english: For safety sake, travel in pairs.
sentences.chinese: 第七，为了安全起见，请两人结伴同行。

sentences.english: Are you travelling to New York, too? We can go together.
sentences.chinese: 你也去纽约吗？我们可结伴同行。

sentences.english: You should use the “buddy system” and never go places alone.
sentences.chinese: 小孩出门应结伴同行，绝不要单独出门。

sentences.english: Yes, life is a journey, one that is much better traveled with a companion by our side.
sentences.chinese: 是的，生命如同旅程，这一路上最好能与人结伴同行。

sentences.english: Although the heart is medium loath, but they or accompany travel together.
sentences.chinese: 虽然心中不情愿，但是他们还是结伴同行。

sentences.english: We need to deepen political mutual trust and remain partners for each other on the way ahead.
sentences.chinese: 我们要深化政治互信，在前进道路上结伴同行。

sentences.english: Sickness and hesitancy go hand in hand.
sentences.chinese: 病痛与犹豫总是结伴同行的。

sentences.english: In that cold rainy night, I had no one to accompany but myself.
sentences.chinese: 是否想说“在很冷的雨夜里，我无人结伴同行”？

definition: to look far ahead/to look forward (to)
to look forward eagerly to sth/keenly desired
to invite sb to go along with oneself (to a meeting, on a trip etc)
to respectfully await/to look forward to
